runs.comm: short of a length on the leg stump which is clipped to fine leg for a single
Ryder pulls out an outrageous pick-up shot which just sails into the square leg stand. And with that another botched attempt by the Orange Brigade
Charles what are you doing? you should have taken that. This one is played uppishly towards short cover, with Charles diving forward, but unable to hold onto the chance
chops this back of a length ball away to the off side
short of a length and once again played to the off side
slanting away off back of a length as Guptill follows this one, getting an outside edge which carries to Ramdin. Guptill storms off and New Zealand already one down
delivers this one full and wide as Ryder fails to get bat on ball
tries again, a tad wider, but this time the umpire is not giving him any license
this one shaping away from outside off as Ryder has a go, but can't get a connection on it
short of a length and smashed through the cover region. Charles once again in the thick of it as he gets his arms outstretched to take most of the malice out of this one. Fine wicketkeeping dive that
back of a length and pulled off the bottom of the bat behind square leg for a boundary
Ryder given room to free his arms and ramp this over third man to the boundary, with the fielder not even in the same frame
unleashes a monster hit into the stands with a pull shot as a gentleman in a suit ends up catching this one cleanly, and then shows off to the masses
length ball outside off which is left alone by the batsman

short and heading down the leg side as McCullum swivels to pull this behind to the vacant fine leg region. The angle was just right for him to play that. Holder needs to look to be more off side to BMac
this time charges the bowler with a flat-batted six straight down the ground. Wellington being set ablaze by some savage strokeplay from the New Zealanders

offers a 'hit-me' full toss as McCullum hits this directly to one of the five wicketkeepers West Indies have in the field, as Fletcher makes a complete hash of it. I reckon Boycott's dead grandmother would have done better

Ryder enticed to go after another one, although this one is devoid of any of Holder's natural pace as this is lofted to Lendl Simmons at deep extra-cover, who takes a wonderful rolling catch to end the Ryder blitzkrieg prematurely
lets this steepler coming into the batsman through to the keeper
shortish length which rises on Taylor as he seems befuddled after playing this off the back foot, with the ball popping up to the off side, but falling safe away from any fielders
good length just outside off as Taylor has a go
pushed off the back foot towards point, but hit a bit too well by Taylor
pulls this back of a length ball straight to mid-on
speared in on middle and leg as McCullum digs this out towards midwicket
moves across his stumps to flick this leg stump bound delivery to the fine leg rope
starts off with a shortish length delivery which is parried to backward point
going down the pads as McCullum clips this uppishly in front of square to the boundary
on the back foot as this is directed to the leg side for a single
Taylor plays this with soft hands to the off side and goes for the run, but when he sees Walton converging on it, decides to turn back, and would have been gone by miles if the direct hit was made
off cutter on leg stump which is helped off the pads to fine leg
Taylor looking for a run with a push to the leg side, but is sent back immediately by McCullum
plays this carefully off the back foot as Narine runs over to field the ball

strikes him on the pads as McCullum looked to turn him away to the leg side, but ends up missing the line. Looked plumb, assuming there is no inside-edge. Doesn't show too much dissatisfaction at the decision as he trudges off to the pavilion
and is off the mark straightaway with a punch off the back foot to the off side
negotiates this one carefully to the off side
moves across his stumps to play this to midwicket for a brace
works this to the leg side for a quick single, and to retain the strike
goes down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide
cuts this length ball away straight to point
played off the back foot towards the fielder at extra-cover
nudges this off the back foot down to mid-on for one
hits him on the pads as this is worked away to the leg side. The fielder was too deep on the leg side as the pair are able to return for a second
played to the man at sweeper cover for one
driven straight to long-off for another easy single
on the back foot as this is nudged down to midwicket for a single
leans over to drive this straight to deep extra-cover
leg side delivery which is turned away by Munro for one
plays this one away to the fielder at backward point, but can't get it past him
drills this one straight to the extra-cover boundary, with the timing so sublime that it reaches the rope without much issue
this time reverts to a cut shot off the back foot which does get past backward point, but not all the way to the rope

and you can add one more to his wicket tally as he gets Munro to lob this straight to Miller, stationed at backward point, who takes the easiest of catches. Russell does a little homage to Brett Lee with that trademark jump after a dismissal
back of a length and shaping away as Anderson decides to leave this alone
gets beaten by the pace of Russell as he looks for a push off the back foot
gets a short ball to climb appreciably over the batsman as he goes for the pull
slower, back of a length delivery which is defended off the back foot
Anderson has had enough and just belts Russell over long-on. Looks like it was going to clear, but the ball falls just short of the rope
prods forward to tuck this away to the leg side for one
this one kind of sits up for Anderson as he gets on the back foot to play a short-arm pull down to the fielder at long-on
flatter delivery on the leg stump which is whisked away to the square leg fielder
this one turns sharply away as Anderson is unlucky to find the fielder
a little more width on offer as Anderson cuts away to deep extra-cover
played off the back foot to long-on for a single
short one which rises on Taylor as he fends this away to the off side

fullish length driven straight back to the bowler as Russell has a roll to stop the ball. The non-striker follows the call from Taylor as he books it to the other end, with Taylor able to make his ground again

slower ball which is lopped up to Charles who should make this catch if only to protect his reputation as a wicketkeeper-batsman. That is now TWO wickets for Russell. I am still surprised, but good on him (and about time, if I may add)

fuller one which is hit straight back to Russell, who probably couldn't believe just how lucky he is to get another chance his way, as he stretches this hands out to try and grab it, but the ball pushes through. So close for Russell. I sincerely hope he gets a five-for today
slower ball on off stump which is played straight to short cover
low full toss on the pads which is eased down to long-on to bring an end another successful over for Russell
driven straight to silly mid-off
happy to nudge this to the leg side for a quick-run two
defended back to the bowler as Miller lets this through the gap in his legs to the fielder at long-off
heading down the leg side as Ronchi plays this one fine down the leg side. Ends up being called a leg-bye
defends this one right back to the bowler
drives this straight to short cover to bring the over to an end
length going down the pads as this is turned away to deep square leg
fuller one which is driven straight to the extra-cover boundary by Taylor
this time hoicks this away to the leg side for one
back of a length as Ronchi gets into position to blast this away over the straight boundary, but the slower off-cutter surprises the wicketkeeper-batsman
full and just outside off as Ronchi times this sweetly to the man at deep extra-cover
steers this one to deep extra-cover to finish the over
full toss driven to long-on for a single
drives this one down to long-off once more

gets deep in his crease as Ronchi is able to hit this one over the midwicket region for six. Much-needed boundary from the wicketkeeper as that required rate escalates. Another dropped catch by the Orange Brigade
this time eases this down to long-on for one
pushes this low full toss down to long-off
helps this off the pads to the fielder at deep fine leg
able to steer this one down to mid-off for a single
this one is wide down the leg side as the umpire gives the signal
drilled down the ground as long-off runs over to field the ball

in the same area as this is smashed back, with long-off just able to make a dive to stop it, but the ball bobbles over behind him. Russell, coming from long-on, is able to run over and stop it from hitting the rope
full again as Ronchi gets on one knee to club him over deep midwicket. A member in the crowd tries a catch, but butchers it unfortunately
full on the pads as this is helped down to the fine leg boundary. This over is turning the tide of the match
full on the pads as Ronchi is able to dig this out to the leg side for a single
Ronchi greets him with a pull off the back foot down to deep midwicket for a brace
plays this one gently off the back foot, but short third man comes into play
a little short from Narine as Ronchi is able to slog sweep him to the square leg boundary for four. Ronchi is playing a gem of an innings here for NZ
once again looks to run this down past short third man
pushed off the back foot as this is worked down to sweeper cover
finishes it off with a knuckleball which misses the outside edge
fuller one on middle and leg which is hit down to long-on
spears in one on middle and off as Ronchi is lucky not to be bowled as he keeps the ball down, but the ball drags behind, just missing contact with the bails or stumps
drives this one straight to mid-off for a single
tried to bowl a slower ball but gets this horribly wrong as the ball bounces feebly to the leg side. Umpire calls a wide
full from Holder as Ronchi lofts this down to the man at deep midwicket, and is able to make it back for the second
full from Holder and all Ronchi needs to do is blaze this back over the bowler's head for a boundary. Ronchi is on his way to emulating his feats from the other match
and Ronchi brings up his fifty with another fine blow which beats the long-on fielder to the boundary. Just 25 balls and he has done exactly what NZ required off him.
cuts this one off the back foot, but can't get it past a diving backward point
defends this off the back foot, but short cover keeps it to just one
defends this one back to the bowler

goes for the big slog-sweep over midwicket but ends up mistiming it as Walton, stationed at deep midwicket, is able to run in to take the catch. Will this wicket help tilt the scales somewhat, or is the match already a foregone conclusion?
jabs this one off the back foot but can't get it past the off side field
defends this one back to the bowler as Narine's exacting spell comes to a close
back of a length which is played to the off side, but a run can not be pinched
plays this off the back foot to the off side, but no run afforded. Good over so far from Best
unlucky for Best as he bowls this in the right channel, but the batsman ends up edging this behind, but with no one in the region, is able to get a fortuitous boundary. Equation now 9 off 9
UNLEASH THE NEESH it is as hits this back of a length delivery so cleanly over midwicket. Just sailed over the ropes as Neesham makes it now 3 off 8

short ball which Neesham decides to have a pull at, but the ball deflects away to hit his body, and then carry on to the third man rope, but is stopped just short, as the pair are able to run two leg-byes
and another short one from Best is sent to the fine leg boundary with a fine hook as New Zealand seal victory with four wickets in hand
